column4: man my computer is the heater in my room but not when I run ubuntu cause it manages the CPU efficiently and therefore less load and heat
maybe I should run Windows Vista temporarily to heat up the room ..lolz
why not do something useful to heighten CPU load, like run a grid project?
in particular I'd advise the climateprediction.net project. Gives your CPU a good workout and helps research into a serious problem to boot.
doesn't cause any particular increase in load.
fluctuates at about 50% for both cores when playing Amaranth on YouTube.
oh okay ... it made all the flash elements flickery and crashed Firefox 3 a lot on mine
it stopped my Firefox crashes with Flash but I do have flicker.
so like you were getting crashes on Beta 1 and then Beta 2 fixed your crashes ??
I got crashes using 9; I last used beta 1 a long time ago so I can't remember if that crashed.
oh okay yeah Beta 1 crashes a lot less than 9 did ... its good to see that those Adobe drongoes have a good stable Flash on the horizon
wasn't that drop down menus behind the flash element the most annoying bug ever in 9 ... they fixed it in Beta 2
and I hope that Flash player 10 will be fully compatible with Compiz including YouTube full screen videos under Compiz
